page.title: 14Local History
page.content: Sudbury has a long history, it was mentioned in the first Domesday Book.It has had a Mayor since c1390 and the townspeople still enjoy walks on the medieval common lands beside the river. There are several buildings of interest including the QUAY THEATRE, the MILL HOTEL and the LIBRARY. Other features include; GAINSBOROUGH'S HOUSE-The eighteenth century portrait and landscape painter Thomas Gainsborough was born in Sudbury and spent some time living and working in the area. His house can be visited. ST GREGORY'S CHURCH-Was mentioned in the Domesday Book and is thought to own the pickled head of Archbishop Simon, born in Sudbury and executed in the peasant's revolt of 1381. ST PETER'S AND ALL SAINTS-Are large and beautiful medieval churches built with the profits of the wool industry.
